fiction.prompt: Smoke and grit flood the space, sightlines collapse.
immediate_choice: Fall back and take a longer route

fiction.prompt: A signal carries, someone has been alerted, help is moving.
immediate_choice: Break line of sight and reposition

fiction.prompt: Stone gives way, the floor shifts, routes change instantly.
immediate_choice: Find a new angle while enemies adjust

fiction.prompt: Civilians scatter unpredictably, complicating lines and choices.
A key resource is lower than expected, you feel it immediately.
A wrong-note hum skates across your senses, something watches back.
Flames catch and spread, the space starts shrinking.
Visibility drops to arm’s length, everyone is guessing.
Movement in your periphery, someone is trying to cut off your options.
Someone with their own agenda moves to complicate yours, or to bargain.
Something loud happens at the worst moment, attention shifts toward you.
Conditions shift sharply, changing what’s possible right now.
immediate_choice: Push through while you still can

fiction.prompt: Light fails at the wrong time, shadows become terrain.
immediate_choice: Use the darkness to break contact

fiction.prompt: A narrow point decides the fight, someone tries to lock it down.
Confusion spreads, the wrong people think they know what’s happening.
A bright signal marks the scene, others will converge soon.
immediate_choice: Break line of sight and withdraw

fiction.prompt: A critical item slips, snaps, or jams, the timing is brutal.
The footing changes, movement becomes a risk and a weapon.
You realize a detail was wrong, your plan needs a fast correction.
Firelines overlap, safe angles disappear.
A tracker force is unleashed, they don’t need sight to find you.
A protective working snaps back, the air tastes like copper.
Two authorities claim control, both expect you to comply.
A crossing is weaker than it looked, the route is about to change.
Sound carries farther than it should, your presence becomes obvious.
Breathing gets harder, timing slips, you feel the tax.
immediate_choice: Keep moving and accept the risk

fiction.prompt: An unexpected gap appears, it won’t last long.
immediate_choice: Save it for a better moment

fiction.prompt: The window closes faster than expected, you feel the squeeze.
Water creeps in, routes narrow, options sink.
immediate_choice: Use the water to your advantage

fiction.prompt: A moving light hunts for motion, the scene becomes a stage.
Vegetation fights your movement and gives away noise.
Someone is documenting what’s happening, the consequences spread.
The air is wrong, every breath becomes a decision.
Someone tries to seal routes and trap you in the scene.
You catch a half-meaning, a hint that isn’t meant for you.
An elevated position changes the geometry of the fight.
Your passage marked the ground, someone could follow this.
Animals flee the area, their panic tells you something moved.
immediate_choice: Use it as cover to relocate

fiction.prompt: Dark clouds roll in, the air shifts, shelter becomes urgent.
Pieces of what happened lie exposed, they tell a story.
Response forces close in, the window to leave is shrinking.
The space protests, settling sounds hint at instability.
Accusations start forming, narratives harden quickly.
Something previously blocked is now accessible, but not for long.
Water levels change, routes appear and vanish.
Debris floats to the surface, revealing what went wrong.
Witnesses interpret what happened, their version spreads faster than truth.
Bureaucratic gears turn, someone official wants answers soon.
Locals avoid this space now, their fear creates new patterns.
Only now does a detail click into place, the meaning was always there.
The fight left marks on the space, the terrain tells what happened.
Someone's weakness or resource is now obvious, new options appear.
The absence of sound suggests something watching, waiting, or fled.
Who stands where has changed, new deals form in the aftermath.
The fight exposed something valuable that was previously hidden.
Locals avoid this space now, their fear creates new patterns.
The encounter left marks that won't fade quickly, everyone carries something now.
Someone else gets credit or blame for what happened, the story is wrong.
Someone helped, or was harmed, and now something is owed.
The conflict made old paths unreliable, new routes emerge.
News of what happened reaches unexpected places and ears.
Someone saw more than intended, they hold a piece of what happened.
Something finite was consumed, future options narrow quietly.
Authority structures flex and adjust, someone gains or loses standing.
How you handled it becomes part of your name here, the label sticks whether you like it or not.
Something you used up earlier now reveals its full cost, the loss compounds.
The environment absorbed what happened, surfaces tell a quiet story to anyone who looks.
The official version forms without you, details shift to fit a cleaner narrative.
Someone who helped now waits for reciprocation, the unspoken debt sits between you.
Which official should handle this remains unclear, the gap creates soft space.
immediate_choice: Claim the space before it fills

fiction.prompt: Forms need filing, questions need answering, the machinery demands acknowledgment.
Allies become polite strangers, doors close quietly, no one explains why.
Support that was promised becomes vague, you realize you're operating alone now.
Load-bearing elements show stress now, the space won't hold forever.
immediate_choice: Use the time while it stands

fiction.prompt: One failure triggers the next, connected systems reveal fragile dependencies.
Something valuable becomes available, but only to those willing to wait and watch.
Routes and suppliers recalibrate around what happened, new channels open or close.
An invisible line forms, locals treat certain spaces or topics differently now.
Eyes linger longer than usual, someone is still processing what they saw.
Someone close doubts you now, the crack is invisible but weight-bearing.
An assurance you gave earlier now feels impossible to keep, others remember it.
Everything takes longer than it should, friction you can't see accumulates.
A route you relied on is no longer safe or permitted, the change wasn't announced.
immediate_choice: Keep using the old one carefully

fiction.prompt: What you did sits differently now that it's done, the choice doesn't feel clean anymore.
Only now does the full price become clear, consequences you didn't see coming arrive.
Multiple incidents connect in hindsight, something larger shows its shape.
A relationship you needed is quietly damaged, repair will cost more than maintaining it would have.
What should have taken hours now needs days, cascading dependencies reveal themselves.
A boundary was crossed that can't be uncrossed, the group knows it even if no one speaks it.
You learn what was really happening only after acting, the full picture reframes everything.
Others now assume you'll handle this kind of thing, the expectation sets without discussion.
A weakness or resource you didn't see before becomes obvious, power shifts suddenly.
Plans fragment mid-execution, everyone assumed someone else would handle it.
Something valuable becomes a point of conflict, multiple parties converge on it.
Official presence imposes itself, the scene must end or escalate further.
An earlier mistake cascades into the current moment, corrections become costly.
Someone is monitoring this approach, your movement is noted before you arrive.
Patterns shift sooner than expected, the ideal moment compresses.
Key details remain obscured, you'll have to act without full knowledge.
Geography forces choices, good angles are limited or costly to reach.
Something forces you to move before you're ready, gaps in preparation become visible.
Someone else is pursuing the same objective, they have a head start.
immediate_choice: Let them arrive first and adapt

fiction.prompt: Someone controls the route or access, they'll permit passage at a price.
Your approach follows a recognizable pattern, someone connects it to prior activity.
immediate_choice: Complete it and deal with awareness

fiction.prompt: Someone or something isn't holding up well, arrival will be messier than planned.
Someone or something is already here that shouldn't be, plans need fast revision.
Attention is diverted elsewhere, the approach becomes easier if you move now.
immediate_choice: Use normal approach to avoid suspicion
